sentences.en: Anything that setsthat kind of adversarial relationship just doesn't work.
sentences.cn: 任何导致这种对立的关系的机制都无法很好地运行.

sentences.en: In 1996, after the amendment of Criminal Procedure Law, the adversarial system was introduced in China.
sentences.cn: 1996年, 我国刑事诉讼法(下称刑诉法)修改后, 引入了英美法系当事人主义的抗辩式庭审模式.

sentences.en: In our country there is an adversarial relationship between government and business.
sentences.cn: 在我国，官商之间存在一种对立关系。

sentences.en: Kill 1000 enemies in multiplayer adversarial with at least 6 players present.
sentences.cn: 多人对抗赛累积共击毙1000个敌人,但至少需6位玩家同场.

sentences.en: the adversarial nature of two-party politics
Their relationship with exchanges need not be wholly adversarial.
sentences.cn: OTC产品与交易所之间不应是完全对抗的关系.

sentences.en: Unfortunately, those kinds of cases are not so easily resolved through our adversarial process.
sentences.cn: 不幸的是, 许多种这样的案件并不能简单地通过我们的对抗制就能解决.

trans.tran_cn: 敌手的，对手的，对抗（性）的
trans.tran_en: an adversarial system, especially in politics and the law, is one in which two sides oppose and attack each other
